title: Steve Miller Band - Milwaukee Summerfest 1982 (Live  2-CD) 2017
description:
Steve Miller Band - Milwaukee Summerfest 1982 (Live  2-CD) 2017 FLAC ak


Steven Haworth "Steve" Miller (born October 5, 1943) is an American guitarist and singer-songwriter. He began his career in blues and blues rock and evolved to a more pop-oriented sound which, from the mid-1970s through the early 1980s, resulted in a series of highly popular singles and albums. Miller was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2016.

The event was controversial due to Miller's remarks about the experience being "unpleasant" and the Hall of Fame was misogynistic and "need to respect the artists they say they’re honoring, which they don't.", and controlling aspects such as the licensing contracts.
The Black Keys, who were told to induct Miller stated that they regretted the experience. Dan Auerbach and Patrick Carney whined, Miller, however had no idea who the band was and did not care. Auerbach and Carney left as soon as they finished their speech and nobody noticed they were gone.    LOL enough history.....

This is a good a listen as it gets. Of course it helps if you like Steve Miller.

If you do.......I guarantee this this time frame in his career he was at the top of his

game and the charts. Although the charts as far as Im concerned are meaningless as far as

an artists skills go it just means that the sheep got with the program while it was still going

LOL.

These were great times....beer 50 cents a cup. Steve Miller was smiling

from ear to ear this entire show. You want kick ass rock with all the dynamic range?

Then I suggest you crank this show on your best system!

Players

Steve Miller – guitar, vocals, harmonica, keyboards, synthesizers (1966–Present)
Kenny Lee Lewis - guitar, bass, backing vocals (1982-1987, 1993–Present)
Gary Mallaber - drums, percussion, keyboards, backing vocals (1976-1987)
Gerald Johnson - bass, backing vocals (1972-1973, 1981-1983)
Byron Allred - keyboards, synthesizers (1976-1987, 1990)
Norton Buffalo - harmonica, guitar, backing vocals (1976-1978, 1982-1987, 1989-2009, died 2009)





A big thankx to plumdusty you were there
